data.title: ‘Every day is so special with you’: Princess Beatrice's husband Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi shares a previously unseen picture of their wedding in a touching anniversary post
data.meta_description: The Duke of York's daughter Princess Beatrice and Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi were married on 17 July 2020
data.text:
Princess Beatrice's husband Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi has shared a previously unseen picture of their wedding, as he paid tribute to the royal in a touching anniversary post.

The couple exchanged vows in a private wedding ceremony in Windsor on 17 July 2020 – and since then, Edoardo has regularly shared poignant messages for the mother-of-one online. In his latest post, he wrote a loving message for the royal and revealed two previously unseen snaps.

Who’s sitting in the Wimbledon Royal Box this year?

Read More

‘I am so grateful for every moment we have shared, every challenge we have overcome, and every dream we have pursued together. I love you more than words can say, and I can't wait to celebrate many more anniversaries with you.’

Property developer Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi, the son of Count Alessandro Mapelli Mozzi, a former British Olympian and Italian nobleman, proposed to Princess Beatrice, the eldest daughter of Prince Andrew and Sarah, Duchess of York, in September 2019. They were long-time family friends but started dating in October 2018.

On Friday 17 July 2020, the couple married at the Royal Chapel of All Saints at Royal Lodge, Windsor, in an intimate family ceremony attended by Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh. The couple had been forced to postpone their planned May wedding due to Covid-19.

Read More

As Gareth Southgate announces his resignation as England manager, meet Mia Southgate, his It girl daughter

She's long been a Tatler favourite, and now all eyes will be on Mia after her father brings an end to his illustrious career at the helm of English football

In a touching tribute to her grandmother, Princess Beatrice wore a vintage dress by Norman Hartnell, on loan from Queen Elizabeth II. The elegant gown was made from Peau De Soie taffeta in shades of ivory, trimmed with ivory Duchess satin and with organza sleeves. Encrusted with diamanté and with a geometric chequered bodice, it was remodelled and fitted for the princess by Angela Kelly, the Queen’s Dresser, and Stewart Parvin.

Princess Beatrice also wore Queen Mary’s diamond fringe tiara, on loan from her grandmother, which was worn by the Queen on her own wedding day in 1947. The exquisite piece was originally made for Queen Mary by Garrard and Co. in 1919, from a diamond necklace that was a wedding day gift from Queen Victoria. The groom, meanwhile, looked distinguished in a morning suit. Princess Beatrice’s ring was designed by Shaun Leane, while Edo’s vintage gold band was designed by Josh Collins.

Who is Lady Starmer? Tatler looks back to a profile published in the January 2023 issue

Princess Beatrice and Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi welcomed daughter Sienna Elizabeth Mapelli Mozzi in September 2021. Edo also shares a son Christopher, known as Wolfie, with ex-parter Dara Huang. Princess Beatrice enjoys a close relationship with her stepson and has brought him to public engagements.
